dimensions.draft: Deep keel 2.20 m / Shoal keel 1.80 m

maintenanceDetails.method: Hose off with freshwater, apply epoxy paint and antifouling, hand rub down with #400 grit sandpaper and water before antifouling.
Rinse with freshwater, scrub with mild detergent. For teak: scrub with water, rub down with fine sandpaper to renovate.
Rinse with freshwater, clean with sponge and window cleaning product.
Rinse with freshwater, clean with sponge and window cleaning product.
Rinse with freshwater and dry. Protect from sun and water using appropriate covers. Unrig whenever possible.
Rinse with freshwater and dry. Protect from sun and water using appropriate covers. Unrig whenever possible.
Rinse with freshwater and dry. Protect from sun and water using appropriate covers. Unrig whenever possible.
Rinse with freshwater and dry. Protect from sun and water using appropriate covers. Unrig whenever possible.
Rinse with freshwater and dry. Protect from sun and water using appropriate covers. Unrig whenever possible.

specifications.function: Used to hoist spinnaker on port side
Used to hoist spinnaker on starboard side

specifications.status: Shall be in its usual place as soon as you are onboard
Must not be blocked, never sealed

safetyMeasures: Do not fit or store flammable materials above/over the stove.
Never leave boat unattended when working.
Ventilate when working.
Do not obstruct air vents.
Do not smoke or use naked flame when locating leak or changing bottle.
If gas smell or burners go out, turn off taps, ventilate, find root cause.
Change cylinder outside boat for integral cylinder stoves.
Test stove before putting back in galley.
Ensure stoves are locked.
Do not use for heating.
Ensure burner taps off before turning on hose/cylinder taps.
Turn off hose/cylinder taps when not in use.
Do not obstruct access to system components.
Flexible hoses changed per country regulations.
Use safety standard hoses.
Do not use storage space for other equipment.
Keep screwthread of cylinder in good condition.
Check regulator yearly, change if necessary.
Use identical regulator.
Empty cylinders taps off and disconnected.
Do not use ammonia-based products to clean or discover leak.
Do not smoke when handling fuel.
Keep fuel in can, away from stove, engine, heat sources.
Follow manufacturer recommendations for filling.
Do not pour spirit directly into burner over stove.
Proscribed fuels: petrol, oil, propane, diesel oil, fuel oil, other flammable materials.
Wipe up any fuel overflow immediately.

specifications.lights: Ceiling Light, Reading Light, Neon Tube

maintenanceDetails.method: Air and ventilate regularly. Take off floorboards and berthspreads and put them vertically when leaving. Protect inside with curtains. Internal woodworks: rinse with freshwater and liquid detergent, polish with chamois leather.

specifications.discharge: Below waterline (implies holding tank or overboard with seacock)

maintenanceDetails.method: Systematically close seacocks after each use. Rinse and drain pans and pumps during winter storage.
Keep as full as possible to avoid condensation.

Never force filling nozzle deep down. Keep an eye on vent hole(s). Cleanse with acetic acid solution (white vinegar) if not used for long. Sterilize with Clonazone tablets (Dygerma in UK) or equivalent.

maintenanceDetails.environmentalNote: In harbour, do not use heads if not equipped with holding tanks.

safety: Must be carefully and safely stowed.
Do not store conductive objects near terminals.
Must be carefully and safely stowed.
Do not store conductive objects near terminals.
Do not work on a live fitting.
Connect boat/shore cable in boat before plugging into shore socket.
Do not immerse boat/shore cable sockets.
Switch off shore supply with switch onboard before plugging/unplugging cable.
Do not tamper with connections. Use compatible connections only.

_additional.wiringSheathFromPanel: From Panel to Automatic Steering Gear

maintenanceDetails.method: Never run electric pump when tank is empty. Clean filter regularly.

subComponents.name: Filter of the Electric Bilge Pump

maintenanceDetails.method: Ensure good working order. Locate on switch and seacocks. Clean intake strumbox and filter regularly.
Ensure good working order. Locate pump and handle. Clean intake strumbox regularly.

subComponents.name: Filter of the Electric Shower Pump

maintenanceDetails.method: Ensure good working order. Clean filter regularly.

components.name: Sea Water Foot Pump Intake – Icebox Outlet Seacock

maintenanceDetails.method: Close all seacocks when leaving the boat. Systematically close seacocks after each use of flushing toilets. Ensure all unused seacocks are closed before going to sea.
Rinse with freshwater at the end of each season.

subParts.name: Engine Control Handle in the Cockpit
Pull Handle to Stop the Fuel Oil Intake

maintenanceDetails.method: Overhaul and maintain by a skilled mechanic. Refer to engine manufacturer instructions. For petrol engine, ventilate compartment for 5 minutes with bilge ventilators before starting. Fixed extinguisher system for petrol engines: know release mechanism.
Change if necessary. Use identical regulator.
Do not use for storing other equipment. Keep screwthread of cylinder in good condition. Ensure empty cylinders taps off and disconnected. Do not use ammonia-based products to clean or discover leak.

maintenance.method: Hose off with freshwater as often as possible. Apply epoxy paint and antifouling. Hand rub down with at least #400 grit sandpaper and water. Regular preventive maintenance of gel coat.

Regularly rinse with freshwater. Regularly scrub deck with a mild detergent liquid. Lubricate blocks, sheaves, turnbuckles, winches, windlass, rails, travellers with grease or light oil. Polish stainless steels.
Scrub with water. No particular protection needed. Rub down with fine sandpaper to renovate look.
Rinse with freshwater. Clean using a sponge and a cleaning product for windows.
Have the whole steering system overhauled every year.

Air and ventilate regularly. Take off floorboards, berthspreads and put them vertically when leaving. Protect with fitted curtains. Keep bilges clean and dry. Rinse varnished internal woodworks with freshwater and liquid detergent, then polish with chamois leather. For fabrics, cushions, lining, contact a skilled specialist.
Sterilize tanks with Clonazone tablets (Dygerma in UK) or equivalent. If not used for a long period, rinse with water and an acetic acid solution (white vinegar).
Have the whole drive system overhauled and maintained by a skilled mechanic. Refer to engine manufacturer's instructions. Keep fuel tank as full as possible to avoid condensation.
Examine and maintain once a year. Rinse running rigging with freshwater at the end of each season.
Rinse with freshwater and let them dry whenever possible. Unrig whenever possible or protect using appropriate covers to shield from sun and water.

Remove all documents, non-essential lines, supplies, clothes, safety equipment, batteries, gas cylinder. Have safety equipment overhauled. Draw up a complete inventory of equipment. Drain freshwater pipes and rinse with water and vinegar. Close water intake seacocks (unless dried out). Rinse and drain toilets pans and pumps. Store sounder and speedometer heads. Carefully drain and dry all bilges. Put floorboards, cushions and berth spreads vertically for airing. Rinse hull, deck, deck fittings with plenty of water, lubricate mechanical parts. Protect boat with fenders, ensure mooring lines are taut. Fix the rudder. Engine winter laying up by a skilled mechanic (depends if afloat or ashore).
